Welcome to Sample’s documentation!¶

sample.matrix_manip.lowdin_orth(A)¶

Performs Lowdin orthogonalization on given matrix A.

This performs a Lowdin orthogonalization on a matrix A, using an SVD-based approach. You may bump into issues if you use this for matrices with linearly dependent columns.

Parameters:A – The matrix to orthogonalize
Returns:Orthogonalized A
sample.matrix_manip.matrix_inv(A, inv=False)¶

Returns square root of matrix A.

Computes and returns the square root of a given positive definite matrix A via an eigendecomposition approach.

Parameters:
  • A – Matrix for which sqare root is computed
  • inv – Whether to conpute inverse square root (defaults to False)
Returns:

Square root of matrix A (invert square root if requested)
sample.do_pickles.make_pickle(a, b, c)¶

Creates a new Python pickle with a, b, and c.
